rdf:Description.dc:title: Kādambarī
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Bāṇabhaṭṭa (ca. 585–650)
Bhūṣaṇabhaṭṭa (fl. 7th cent.)
Caroline Mary Ridding (1862–1941)

rdf:Description.dc:description: Kādambarī is a romantic novel originally writtin in Sanskrit. It was composed in the first half of the seventh century by Bāṇabhaṭṭa and after his death completed by his son Bhūṣaṇabhaṭṭa, following the plot laid out by his father. This work is one of the first novels in the world.
